sections.procedure:
1.  The case originated in an application (no. 22743/07) against the Republic of Moldova lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by a Moldovan national, Ms Svetlana Otgon (“the applicant”), on 20 April 2007.
2.  The Moldovan Government (“the Government”) were represented by their Agent, Mr V. Grosu.
3.  The applicant alleged, in particular, that she had received insufficient compensation for an established violation of her rights under Article 8 of the Convention.
4.  On 30 November 2009 the application was communicated to the Government.
sections.circumstances:
5.  The applicant was born in 1963 and lives in Călărași.
6.  On 26 October 2005 the applicant and her daughter drank water from taps in their apartment and shortly thereafter they felt unwell. On 29 October 2005 the applicant’s daughter, who was twelve at the time, was admitted to hospital with a diagnosis of “serious acute dysentery”. The applicant was admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis on 31 October 2005. She was released from hospital on 13 November 2005, a day later than her daughter.
7.  The applicant lodged a court action against the local utilities provider (“the provider”), a State-owned company, claiming 100,000 Moldovan lei (“MDL”, approximately 6,700 euros (EUR) at the time) in compensation for the harm caused to her health and for the related inconveniences, including subsequent investigations and disinfection.
8.  On 1 March 2006 the Călăraşi District Court found in her favour. It found that various sanitary, medical and technical reports had established that in the vicinity of the applicant’s apartment block the sewage pipe was situated above the drinking water pipe and was leaking. The water pipe had cracked on 26 October 2005 and sewage water had infiltrated the drinking water pipe. The court also established that the pipes had been used since 1977 and that their expected lifespan was fifteen years. A total of five people, all of whom had drunk water from taps connected to the same water pipe, had been admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis at approximately the same time as the applicant. Taking into consideration such elements as the amount of physical and mental suffering caused to the applicant and her daughter, the court awarded her MDL 10,000 (approximately EUR 648 at the time).
9.  The parties appealed. On 26 April 2006 the Chişinău Court of Appeal rejected the applicant’s appeal and partly accepted the provider’s appeal. It reduced the award to MDL 5,000 (EUR 310) because it found exaggerated “both the sum claimed by [the applicant] and that awarded to [her]”.
10.  The parties appealed. On 25 October 2006 the Supreme Court of Justice upheld the judgment of 26 April 2006. It found that the lower court had taken into consideration the nature and seriousness of the mental suffering caused to the applicant, as well as the degree of guilt of the defendant. That judgment was final.

events.source_text: The case originated in an application (no. 22743/07) against the Republic of Moldova lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by a Moldovan national, Ms Svetlana Otgon (“the applicant”), on 20 April 2007.
The Moldovan Government (“the Government”) were represented by their Agent, Mr V. Grosu.
The applicant alleged, in particular, that she had received insufficient compensation for an established violation of her rights under Article 8 of the Convention.
On 30 November 2009 the application was communicated to the Government.
The applicant was born in 1963 and lives in Călărași.

On 26 October 2005 the applicant and her daughter drank water from taps in their apartment and shortly thereafter they felt unwell. On 29 October 2005 the applicant’s daughter, who was twelve at the time, was admitted to hospital with a diagnosis of ‘serious acute dysentery’. The applicant was admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis on 31 October 2005. She was released from hospital on 13 November 2005, a day later than her daughter.

The applicant lodged a court action against the local utilities provider (“the provider”), a State-owned company, claiming 100,000 Moldovan lei (“MDL”, approximately 6,700 euros (EUR) at the time) in compensation for the harm caused to her health and for the related inconveniences, including subsequent investigations and disinfection.

On 1 March 2006 the Călăraşi District Court found in her favour. It found that various sanitary, medical and technical reports had established that in the vicinity of the applicant’s apartment block the sewage pipe was situated above the drinking water pipe and was leaking. The water pipe had cracked on 26 October 2005 and sewage water had infiltrated the drinking water pipe. The court also established that the pipes had been used since 1977 and that their expected lifespan was fifteen years. A total of five people, all of whom had drunk water from taps connected to the same water pipe, had been admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis at approximately the same time as the applicant. Taking into consideration such elements as the amount of physical and mental suffering caused to the applicant and her daughter, the court awarded her MDL 10,000 (approximately EUR 648 at the time).

The parties appealed. On 26 April 2006 the Chişinău Court of Appeal rejected the applicant’s appeal and partly accepted the provider’s appeal. It reduced the award to MDL 5,000 (EUR 310) because it found exaggerated ‘both the sum claimed by [the applicant] and that awarded to [her]’.

The parties appealed. On 25 October 2006 the Supreme Court of Justice upheld the judgment of 26 April 2006. It found that the lower court had taken into consideration the nature and seriousness of the mental suffering caused to the applicant, as well as the degree of guilt of the defendant. That judgment was final.

events.event: holds that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention
events.event_what: holds that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention

events.source_text: Dismisses , unanimously, the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction.
events.event: dismisses the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction
events.event_what: dismisses the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction

events.source_text: The case originated in an application (no. 22743/07) against the Republic of Moldova lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by a Moldovan national, Ms Svetlana Otgon (“the applicant”), on 20 April 2007.
The Moldovan Government (“the Government”) were represented by their Agent, Mr V. Grosu.
The applicant alleged, in particular, that she had received insufficient compensation for an established violation of her rights under Article 8 of the Convention.
On 30 November 2009 the application was communicated to the Government.
The applicant was born in 1963 and lives in Călărași.

On 26 October 2005 the applicant and her daughter drank water from taps in their apartment and shortly thereafter they felt unwell. On 29 October 2005 the applicant’s daughter, who was twelve at the time, was admitted to hospital with a diagnosis of ‘serious acute dysentery’. The applicant was admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis on 31 October 2005. She was released from hospital on 13 November 2005, a day later than her daughter.

The applicant lodged a court action against the local utilities provider (“the provider”), a State-owned company, claiming 100,000 Moldovan lei (“MDL”, approximately 6,700 euros (EUR) at the time) in compensation for the harm caused to her health and for the related inconveniences, including subsequent investigations and disinfection.

On 1 March 2006 the Călăraşi District Court found in her favour. It found that various sanitary, medical and technical reports had established that in the vicinity of the applicant’s apartment block the sewage pipe was situated above the drinking water pipe and was leaking. The water pipe had cracked on 26 October 2005 and sewage water had infiltrated the drinking water pipe. The court also established that the pipes had been used since 1977 and that their expected lifespan was fifteen years. A total of five people, all of whom had drunk water from taps connected to the same water pipe, had been admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis at approximately the same time as the applicant. Taking into consideration such elements as the amount of physical and mental suffering caused to the applicant and her daughter, the court awarded her MDL 10,000 (approximately EUR 648 at the time).

The parties appealed. On 26 April 2006 the Chişinău Court of Appeal rejected the applicant’s appeal and partly accepted the provider’s appeal. It reduced the award to MDL 5,000 (EUR 310) because it found exaggerated ‘both the sum claimed by [the applicant] and that awarded to [her]’.

The parties appealed. On 25 October 2006 the Supreme Court of Justice upheld the judgment of 26 April 2006. It found that the lower court had taken into consideration the nature and seriousness of the mental suffering caused to the applicant, as well as the degree of guilt of the defendant. That judgment was final.

events.source_text: The case originated in an application (no. 22743/07) against the Republic of Moldova lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by a Moldovan national, Ms Svetlana Otgon (“the applicant”), on 20 April 2007.
The Moldovan Government (“the Government”) were represented by their Agent, Mr V. Grosu.
The applicant alleged, in particular, that she had received insufficient compensation for an established violation of her rights under Article 8 of the Convention.
On 30 November 2009 the application was communicated to the Government.
On 26 October 2005 the applicant and her daughter drank water from taps in their apartment and shortly thereafter they felt unwell.
On 29 October 2005 the applicant’s daughter, who was twelve at the time, was admitted to hospital with a diagnosis of “serious acute dysentery”.
The applicant was admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis on 31 October 2005.
She was released from hospital on 13 November 2005, a day later than her daughter.

The applicant lodged a court action against the local utilities provider (“the provider”), a State-owned company, claiming 100,000 Moldovan lei (“MDL”, approximately 6,700 euros (EUR) at the time) in compensation for the harm caused to her health and for the related inconveniences, including subsequent investigations and disinfection.
On 1 March 2006 the Călăraşi District Court found in her favour.

It found that various sanitary, medical and technical reports had established that in the vicinity of the applicant’s apartment block the sewage pipe was situated above the drinking water pipe and was leaking.
The water pipe had cracked on 26 October 2005 and sewage water had infiltrated the drinking water pipe.
The court also established that the pipes had been used since 1977 and that their expected lifespan was fifteen years.
A total of five people, all of whom had drunk water from taps connected to the same water pipe, had been admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis at approximately the same time as the applicant.
Taking into consideration such elements as the amount of physical and mental suffering caused to the applicant and her daughter, the court awarded her MDL 10,000 (approximately EUR 648 at the time).
The parties appealed. On 26 April 2006 the Chişinău Court of Appeal rejected the applicant’s appeal and partly accepted the provider’s appeal.
It reduced the award to MDL 5,000 (EUR 310) because it found exaggerated “both the sum claimed by [the applicant] and that awarded to [her]”.
The parties appealed. On 25 October 2006 the Supreme Court of Justice upheld the judgment of 26 April 2006.
It found that the lower court had taken into consideration the nature and seriousness of the mental suffering caused to the applicant, as well as the degree of guilt of the defendant.
Declares , by a majority, the application admissible;
Holds , by six votes to one, that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;

Holds , by six votes to one (a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the sum of EUR 4,000 (four thousand euros), to be converted into Moldovan lei at the rate applicable at the date of settlement;
Dismisses , unanimously, the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction.

The case originated in an application (no. 22743/07) against the Republic of Moldova lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by a Moldovan national, Ms Svetlana Otgon (“the applicant”), on 20 April 2007.
The Moldovan Government (“the Government”) were represented by their Agent, Mr V. Grosu.
The applicant alleged, in particular, that she had received insufficient compensation for an established violation of her rights under Article 8 of the Convention.
On 30 November 2009 the application was communicated to the Government.
On 26 October 2005 the applicant and her daughter drank water from taps in their apartment and shortly thereafter they felt unwell.
On 29 October 2005 the applicant’s daughter, who was twelve at the time, was admitted to hospital with a diagnosis of “serious acute dysentery”.
The applicant was admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis on 31 October 2005.
She was released from hospital on 13 November 2005, a day later than her daughter.

The applicant lodged a court action against the local utilities provider (“the provider”), a State-owned company, claiming 100,000 Moldovan lei (“MDL”, approximately 6,700 euros (EUR) at the time) in compensation for the harm caused to her health and for the related inconveniences, including subsequent investigations and disinfection.
On 1 March 2006 the Călăraşi District Court found in her favour.

It found that various sanitary, medical and technical reports had established that in the vicinity of the applicant’s apartment block the sewage pipe was situated above the drinking water pipe and was leaking.
The water pipe had cracked on 26 October 2005 and sewage water had infiltrated the drinking water pipe.
The court also established that the pipes had been used since 1977 and that their expected lifespan was fifteen years.
A total of five people, all of whom had drunk water from taps connected to the same water pipe, had been admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis at approximately the same time as the applicant.
Taking into consideration such elements as the amount of physical and mental suffering caused to the applicant and her daughter, the court awarded her MDL 10,000 (approximately EUR 648 at the time).
The parties appealed. On 26 April 2006 the Chişinău Court of Appeal rejected the applicant’s appeal and partly accepted the provider’s appeal.
It reduced the award to MDL 5,000 (EUR 310) because it found exaggerated “both the sum claimed by [the applicant] and that awarded to [her]”.
The parties appealed. On 25 October 2006 the Supreme Court of Justice upheld the judgment of 26 April 2006.
It found that the lower court had taken into consideration the nature and seriousness of the mental suffering caused to the applicant, as well as the degree of guilt of the defendant.
Declares , by a majority, the application admissible;
Holds , by six votes to one, that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;

Holds , by six votes to one (a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the sum of EUR 4,000 (four thousand euros), to be converted into Moldovan lei at the rate applicable at the date of settlement;
Dismisses , unanimously, the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction.

The case originated in an application (no. 22743/07) against the Republic of Moldova lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms ("the Convention") by a Moldovan national, Ms Svetlana Otgon ("the applicant"), on 20 April 2007.
4. On 30 November 2009 the application was communicated to the Government.
6. On 26 October 2005 the applicant and her daughter drank water from taps in their apartment and shortly thereafter they felt unwell.
6. ... On 29 October 2005 the applicant’s daughter, who was twelve at the time, was admitted to hospital with a diagnosis of "serious acute dysentery".
6. ... The applicant was admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis on 31 October 2005.

7. The applicant lodged a court action against the local utilities provider ("the provider"), a State-owned company, claiming 100,000 Moldovan lei ("MDL", approximately 6,700 euros (EUR) at the time) in compensation for the harm caused to her health and for the related inconveniences, including subsequent investigations and disinfection.
8. On 1 March 2006 the Călăraşi District Court found in her favour.
9. The parties appealed.
9. ... On 26 April 2006 the Chişinău Court of Appeal rejected the applicant’s appeal and partly accepted the provider’s appeal.

events.source_text: 10. The parties appealed.
10. ... On 25 October 2006 the Supreme Court of Justice upheld the judgment of 26 April 2006.
FOR THESE REASONS, THE COURT 1. Declares, by a majority, the application admissible;
2. Holds, by six votes to one, that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;

events.source_text: 3. Holds, by six votes to one (a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the sum of EUR 4,000 (four thousand euros),

events.source_text: 4. Dismisses, unanimously, the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction.
events.event_what: Dismisses the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction

events.source_text: 1. Declares, by a majority, the application admissible;
events.event: The court declared the application admissible

events.source_text: 2. Holds, by six votes to one, that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;
events.event: The court held a violation of Article 8 of the Convention
events.event_what: held a violation of Article 8 of the Convention

events.source_text: 3. Holds, by six votes to one

(a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the sum of EUR 4,000 (four thousand euros), to be converted into Moldovan lei at the rate applicable at the date of settlement;
events.event: The court ordered payment of compensation

events.source_text: (b) that from the expiry of the above-mentioned three months until settlement simple interest shall be payable on the above amount at a rate equal to the marginal lending rate of the European Central Bank during the default period plus three percentage points;
events.event: The court ordered payment with interest

events.source_text: 4. Dismisses, unanimously, the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction.
Done in English, and notified in writing on 25 October 2016, pursuant to Rule 77 §§ 2 and 3 of the Rules of Court.

The case originated in an application (no. 22743/07) against the Republic of Moldova lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by a Moldovan national, Ms Svetlana Otgon (“the applicant”), on 20 April 2007.
The Moldovan Government (“the Government”) were represented by their Agent, Mr V. Grosu.
The applicant alleged, in particular, that she had received insufficient compensation for an established violation of her rights under Article 8 of the Convention.
On 30 November 2009 the application was communicated to the Government.
The applicant was born in 1963 and lives in Călărași.
On 26 October 2005 the applicant and her daughter drank water from taps in their apartment and shortly thereafter they felt unwell.

The applicant was admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis on 31 October 2005. She was released from hospital on 13 November 2005, a day later than her daughter.

events.event_what: was admitted to hospital, released from hospital

events.source_text: The applicant lodged a court action against the local utilities provider (“the provider”), a State-owned company, claiming 100,000 Moldovan lei (“MDL”, approximately 6,700 euros (EUR) at the time) in compensation for the harm caused to her health and for the related inconveniences, including subsequent investigations and disinfection.
On 1 March 2006 the Călăraşi District Court found in her favour.
events.event: Court decision in favor of applicant

events.source_text: It found that various sanitary, medical and technical reports had established that in the vicinity of the applicant’s apartment block the sewage pipe was situated above the drinking water pipe and was leaking. The water pipe had cracked on 26 October 2005 and sewage water had infiltrated the drinking water pipe.

The court also established that the pipes had been used since 1977 and that their expected lifespan was fifteen years. A total of five people, all of whom had drunk water from taps connected to the same water pipe, had been admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis at approximately the same time as the applicant.

events.source_text: Taking into consideration such elements as the amount of physical and mental suffering caused to the applicant and her daughter, the court awarded her MDL 10,000 (approximately EUR 648 at the time).

The parties appealed. On 25 October 2006 the Supreme Court of Justice upheld the judgment of 26 April 2006.
FOR THESE REASONS, THE COURT
Declares , by a majority, the application admissible;
Holds , by six votes to one, that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;
events.event: Violation of Article 8 of the Convention

events.source_text: Holds , by six votes to one (a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the sum of EUR 4,000 (four thousand euros), to be converted into Moldovan lei at the rate applicable at the date of settlement;
events.event: Compensation award by European Court of Human Rights

events.source_text: (b) that from the expiry of the above-mentioned three months until settlement simple interest shall be payable on the above amount at a rate equal to the marginal lending rate of the European Central Bank during the default period plus three percentage points;
Dismisses , unanimously, the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction.

The case originated in an application (no. 22743/07) against the Republic of Moldova lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by a Moldovan national, Ms Svetlana Otgon (“the applicant”), on 20 April 2007.
The Moldovan Government (“the Government”) were represented by their Agent, Mr V. Grosu.
The applicant alleged, in particular, that she had received insufficient compensation for an established violation of her rights under Article 8 of the Convention.
On 30 November 2009 the application was communicated to the Government.
The applicant was born in 1963 and lives in Călărași.
On 26 October 2005 the applicant and her daughter drank water from taps in their apartment and shortly thereafter they felt unwell.
events.event_who: Applicant (Ms. Svetlana Otgon) and her daughter

events.source_text: On 29 October 2005 the applicant’s daughter, who was twelve at the time, was admitted to hospital with a diagnosis of “serious acute dysentery”. The applicant was admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis on 31 October 2005. She was released from hospital on 13 November 2005, a day later than her daughter.
events.event_who: Applicant (Ms. Svetlana Otgon) and her daughter
events.event_what: was admitted to hospital, released from hospital

events.source_text: The applicant lodged a court action against the local utilities provider (“the provider”), a State-owned company, claiming 100,000 Moldovan lei (“MDL”, approximately 6,700 euros (EUR) at the time) in compensation for the harm caused to her health and for the related inconveniences, including subsequent investigations and disinfection.
On 1 March 2006 the Călăraşi District Court found in her favour.
events.event: Court decision in favor of applicant

events.source_text: It found that various sanitary, medical and technical reports had established that in the vicinity of the applicant’s apartment block the sewage pipe was situated above the drinking water pipe and was leaking. The water pipe had cracked on 26 October 2005 and sewage water had infiltrated the drinking water pipe.

The court also established that the pipes had been used since 1977 and that their expected lifespan was fifteen years. A total of five people, all of whom had drunk water from taps connected to the same water pipe, had been admitted to hospital with the same diagnosis at approximately the same time as the applicant.
events.event_what: established, had been admitted to hospital

events.source_text: Taking into consideration such elements as the amount of physical and mental suffering caused to the applicant and her daughter, the court awarded her MDL 10,000 (approximately EUR 648 at the time).
The parties appealed. On 26 April 2006 the Chişinău Court of Appeal rejected the applicant’s appeal and partly accepted the provider’s appeal.
It reduced the award to MDL 5,000 (EUR 310) because it found exaggerated “both the sum claimed by [the applicant] and that awarded to [her]”.
The parties appealed. On 25 October 2006 the Supreme Court of Justice upheld the judgment of 26 April 2006.
FOR THESE REASONS, THE COURT
Declares , by a majority, the application admissible;
Holds , by six votes to one, that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;
events.event: Violation of Article 8 of the Convention

events.source_text: Holds , by six votes to one (a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the sum of EUR 4,000 (four thousand euros), to be converted into Moldovan lei at the rate applicable at the date of settlement;
events.event: Compensation award by European Court of Human Rights

events.source_text: (b) that from the expiry of the above-mentioned three months until settlement simple interest shall be payable on the above amount at a rate equal to the marginal lending rate of the European Central Bank during the default period plus three percentage points;
Dismisses , unanimously, the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction.

1. The case originated in an application (no. 22743/07) against the Republic of Moldova lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by a Moldovan national, Ms Svetlana Otgon (“the applicant”), on 20 April 2007.
2. The Moldovan Government (“the Government”) were represented by their Agent, Mr V. Grosu.
3. The applicant alleged, in particular, that she had received insufficient compensation for an established violation of her rights under Article 8 of the Convention.
4. On 30 November 2009 the application was communicated to the Government.
5. The applicant was born in 1963 and lives in Călărași.
6. On 26 October 2005 the applicant and her daughter drank water from taps in their apartment and shortly thereafter they felt unwell.
events.event_who: Ms. Svetlana Otgon (applicant) and her daughter

events.source_text: 7. The applicant lodged a court action against the local utilities provider (“the provider”), a State-owned company, claiming 100,000 Moldovan lei (“MDL”, approximately 6,700 euros (EUR) at the time) in compensation for the harm caused to her health and for the related inconveniences, including subsequent investigations and disinfection.
8. On 1 March 2006 the Călăraşi District Court found in her favour.
events.event_what: found in favour of Ms. Svetlana Otgon (applicant)

events.source_text: 9. The parties appealed.
10. On 26 April 2006 the Chişinău Court of Appeal rejected the applicant’s appeal and partly accepted the provider’s appeal.
events.event_what: rejected an appeal and partly accepted another appeal

events.source_text: 11. The parties appealed.
12. On 25 October 2006 the Supreme Court of Justice upheld the judgment of 26 April 2006.
13. FOR THESE REASONS, THE COURT
1. Declares, by a majority, the application admissible;
2. Holds, by six votes to one, that there has been a violation of Article 8 of the Convention;
events.event_what: found a violation of Article 8 of the Convention

events.source_text: 3. Holds, by six votes to one

a) that the respondent State is to pay the applicant, within three months from the date on which the judgment becomes final in accordance with Article 44 § 2 of the Convention, the sum of EUR 4,000 (four thousand euros), to be converted into Moldovan lei at the rate applicable at the date of settlement;
4. Dismisses, unanimously, the remainder of the applicant’s claim for just satisfaction.
Done in English, and notified in writing on 25 October 2016, pursuant to Rule 77 §§ 2 and 3 of the Rules of Court.
pursuant to Rule 77 §§ 2 and 3 of the Rules of Court.
